column1: Usually the download is seen of network share and USB devices. Can I asume you are refering to them?

ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0CGK3u:ref","Re: Netwrix Support Ticket #412905 -  - Need help to diffrentiate download/upload files from Cososys alerts    [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0CGK3u:ref ]","arpitha.shetty@servicenow.com","Arpitha Shetty","techsupport@netwrix.com","eric.haverly@netwrix.com","","true","2024-06-26T04:12:16.000Z","true"

Unfortunately you cannot differentiate between downloaded and uploaded files with DPI disabled. DPI has to be enabled from server UI and the DPI certificate needs to be added on the MacOS Keychain app and marked as Trusted, in order to help with this use case.
You can find more information on how to enable DPI correctly on MacOS here :
I recommend that you test on a couple of test machines first (preferably on your epp test environment).
We are doing a POC for DPI but there is a conflict with Zscaler. ""
If there is a separate support ticket opened for this then please continue the investigation on the corresponding ticket. Otherwise I will ask you to please open a separate support ticket.
Subject: Re: Netwrix Support Ticket #412905 - - Need help to diffrentiate download/upload files from Cososys alerts [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0CGK3u:ref ]
I have another case open with Netwrix to work on the DPI. DPI did not help us with the latest agent.
I wouldn’t agree they are false positives. I see the alerts only when I download the files.

So, are you saying we cannot differentiate between downloaded and uploaded files without DPI enabled?
Subject: Re: Netwrix Support Ticket #412905 - - Need help to diffrentiate download/upload files from Cososys alerts [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0CGK3u:ref ]

You should have more information in the ""Destination Details"" field in CAP reports when having DPI enabled along with 'Reporting V2' option (which should be enabled by default in newer server versions).
